citation.article-title: Olivibacter soli sp. nov., Olivibacter ginsengisoli sp. nov. and Olivibacter terrae sp. nov., from soil of a ginseng field and compost in South Korea.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Olivibacter terrae sp. nov.
Olivibacter terrae (ter′rae. L. gen. n. terrae of the earth).
Colonies grown on R2A agar plates are smooth, circular, convex, non-luminescent, opaque and yellowish in colour within 5 days at 30 °C.
Growth is observed at temperatures of 15–30 °C, at pH 6.0–8.0 and with 0–4 % (w/v) NaCl.
The optimal growth temperature and pH are 30 °C and pH 7.0. N-Acetyl-d-glucosamine, arabinose, glycogen, gluconate, d-mannose, rhamnose and d-ribose are assimilated.

Positive for hydrolysis of aesculin and gelatin and for N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, acid phosphatase, alkaline phosphatase, arginine dihydrolase, cystine arylamidase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, β-glucuronidase, leucine arylamidase, urease and valine arylamidase and glucose fermentation.

Negative reactions are observed for α-fucosidase, β-galactosidase, lipase (C14), naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase and α-mannosidase and for assimilation of adipate, l-alanine, caprate, l-fucose, 3-hydroxybenzoate, 4-hydroxybenzoate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, itaconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, lactate, malate, malonate, melibiose, phenylacetate, l-proline, propionate, salicin, suberate and valerate.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 40.6 mol%.
The type strain, Jip13T (=KCTC 12644T =LMG 23494T), was isolated from compost, composed of cow dung and rice straw, collected in Chungwon Province, South Korea.
